revised_title: The Influence of Salts and Non-Electrolytes on the Sucroclastic Action of Acids
tldr: The authors investigate the influence of salts and non-electrolytes on the sucroclastic action of acids, finding that alcohol has a marked inhibiting effect, while metallic salts accelerate the rate of hydrolysis. The study highlights the importance of maintaining consistent proportions of water and acid in experiments to accurately determine the effects of added substances.
